;

;

;

;

;博尔索纳罗被指控伪造一场否认选举运动，该运动在 1 月 8 日;数千名他的支持者冲进了巴西利亚的政府大楼;。巴西联邦选举法院已禁止他在 2030 年之前竞选公职。

;

;部长前往里斯本，向欧洲运营商和投资者介绍了这些项目的计划，他说，这是将在德国、阿拉伯联合酋长国、印度和中国继续进行的路演的一部分。

;

;他说。 Filho在接受采访时表示，巴西政府还将在路易斯·伊纳西奥·卢拉·达席尔瓦总统2023-2026年任期内投资约800亿雷亚尔。但大约 35 项招标应该会吸引两倍于私营部门的投资。

;

;他表示，巴西的目标是扩大其以货运为主的铁路系统，到 2035 年运输出口量的 40%，高于目前的 17%。 .

;

;这位来自东北部阿拉戈斯州一个强大政治家族的部长表示，巴西的横贯北方铁路已经建设了 15 年多，但只完成了一半，可能是此次扩建的关键.

;

;Transnordestina 旨在将大豆、玉米、铁矿石和石膏等商品从皮奥伊州向北运送到佩西姆北部港口，向东运送到苏阿佩港口。

;

;Filho 表示，全长 1,700 公里（1,056 英里）的项目的第一段，即皮奥伊-佩西姆连接线，将于 2027 年初完工。整个佩西姆-苏阿佩路线的建设将于今年开始，预计将于 2027 年初完成。五年。

;

;Filho 表示，定于下个月提交的国家铁路计划将包括 6 条新的客运线路，包括从首都巴西利亚到中部戈亚斯州以及从圣保罗到巴拉那州。巴西目前仅运营两条州际客运铁路。

;

;“我们相信这个（客运列车）是我们需要推进和发展的领域，”Filho 说。

;

;（1 美元） = 4.9175 雷亚尔)

; Fri, 22 Sep 2023 04:25:04 +0800 Sam Bankman-Fried to stay in jail, appeals court ruleshttps://reuters.com/article/usa-bankmanfried-bail/sam-bankman-fried-to-stay-in-jail-appeals-court-rules-idUSKBN30R1VS

;;破产的加密货币交易所 FTX 的创始人 Sam Bankman-Fried 抵达法庭，律师正在努力说服监督其欺诈案的法官不要这样做2023 年 8 月 11 日，美国纽约一家法院，在审判前将他监禁。 REUTERS/Eduardo Munoz/File Photo;
;

;周四，美国上诉法院维持了法官的决定，前加密货币亿万富翁 Sam Bankman-Fried 因 2022 年 11 月破产的 FTX 交易所倒闭而被指控欺诈，并于 10 月 3 日接受审判。该判决由美国第二巡回法院做出。曼哈顿上诉。

;

;美国地区法官刘易斯·卡普兰 (Lewis Kaplan) ;8 月 11 日撤销 Bankman-Fried 2.5 亿美元的保释金;，找到合理的理由相信被告篡改了证人。

;

;这包括他的;与《纽约时报》记者分享其 Alameda Research 对冲基金前首席执行官卡罗琳·埃里森 (Caroline Ellison) 的个人著作;。

;

;埃里森已;认罪欺诈;，预计将出庭指控前恋人班克曼-弗里德。在她的著作中，她描述了对自己的工作感到“不开心和不知所措”，并因与班克曼-弗里德的分手而“受伤/被拒绝”。

;

;班克曼-弗里德的一名律师于 9 月 19 日向上诉法院表示。卡普兰未能赞扬被告行使其第一修正案宪法权利，与媒体交谈并试图恢复他的声誉。

;

;;上诉法院似乎持怀疑态度;。一位法官表示，第一修正案并不保护证人篡改行为，而另一位法官则表示，通过泄露个人信息公开羞辱某人可能会被视为试图影响他们的证词。

;

;但法官们似乎对班克曼持更开放的态度——弗里德称，布鲁克林大都会拘留中心缺乏互联网接入，阻碍了他为这起复杂案件的审判做准备。

;

;检察官丹妮尔·沙逊表示，她的办公室已采取“非常措施”来帮助班克曼-弗里德准备接受审判，在被关押之前，他在加利福尼亚州帕洛阿尔托父母的家中度过了七个月的网络连接时间。

;

;“如果他确实恐吓证人，那么在一定程度上巡回法官威廉·纳尔迪尼 (William Nardini) 说：“重点是，他自己铺床，睡在上面。”

;

;Bankman-Fried 因现已破产的加密货币交易所 FTX 的倒闭而面临七项欺诈和共谋指控

;

;检察官指控他掠夺了数十亿美元的 FTX 客户资金，以弥补阿拉米达的损失、购买豪华房地产并为美国政治竞选活动捐款。

;

;年轻的默多克将主持;有影响力的新闻品牌; 例如澳大利亚、美国和英国的《华尔街日报》、《福克斯新闻》和《太阳报》，以及福克斯体育、福克斯娱乐等。

;

;Lachlan，52 岁，是第三位最年长的报纸鲁珀特·默多克的六个孩子。默多克和他的第二任妻子安娜出生于伦敦，他从小就沉浸在媒体行业中。他在接受澳大利亚广播公司“王朝”节目采访时表示，每天早上，在乘校车之前，他和兄弟姐妹都会阅读早报——《纽约邮报》、《纽约时报》、《每日新闻》和《每日新闻》。华尔街日报 - 他的父亲标记感兴趣的故事，命令：“读那个。”

;

;

;竞争据一份公开报道称，拉克兰和他的弟弟詹姆斯从小就开始玩大富翁游戏，即使是家庭大富翁游戏也“很激烈，每个人都准备作弊”。

;

;默多克和他的兄弟姐妹参加了根据引用的年鉴条目，道尔顿是曼哈顿上东区的一所私立学校，以及其他精英学校，包括他在那里组建了三一保守协会的三一学校，“试图在所有观点之间建立健康的平衡”

;

;1994 年，拉克兰从普林斯顿大学哲学专业毕业后，进入家族企业，在澳大利亚待了三年，逐步晋升为新闻有限公司董事长。

;

;拉克兰返回纽约加入新闻集团。他升任副首席运营官，负责监管该公司的美国电视台集团和出版资产，包括《纽约邮报》。许多人认为他正在接受培训，准备作为他父亲的继任者掌管公司。

;

;他于 2005 年突然辞职，引发了关于谁将接替鲁珀特·默多克 (Rupert Murdoch) 掌舵公司的疑问。 ;他从澳大利亚一家报纸组建的媒体帝国;。拉克兰·默多克 (Lachlan Murdoch) 创立了私人投资公司 Illyria Pty，其收购的项目包括澳大利亚广播电台网络。 2015 年，他重返家族企业，与弟弟詹姆斯共同担任 21 世纪福克斯公司联席董事长。

;

;

;兄弟詹姆斯·默多克随着迪士尼交易的完成，拉克兰离开了福克斯。

;

;自 2019 年以来，拉克兰担任福克斯公司首席执行官，在行业发生巨变期间，随着观众削减有线电视订阅以支持流媒体，拉克兰一直负责媒体资产服务。即便如此，福克斯新闻在很大程度上保持了其收视主导地位，部分原因是它对政治保守倾向的美国观众的吸引力。

; Fri, 22 Sep 2023 03:55:04 +0800 Record numbers of migrants head to US border, in fresh test for Bidenhttps://reuters.com/article/usa-immigration-mexico/record-numbers-of-migrants-head-to-us-border-in-fresh-test-for-biden-idUSKBN30R1UP
;;2023-09-21T19:42:22Z;
;

;Thousands of migrants have crossed into the United States in recent days, from California to Texas, with many more still arriving by bus and cargo trains to Mexican border towns on the heels of record migration flows further south.

;

;The dramatic increase along the border - notably in San Diego, California and the Texan cities of El Paso and Eagle Pass - marks a turning point after numbers had plummeted in recent months, and could create fresh political challenges for US President Joe Biden heading into election season.

;

;Biden in May rolled out a new policy ;to deter illegal crossings;, including deporting migrants and banning re-entry for five years, as his administration grappled with migration at record highs.

;

;Within a month the tougher measures drove the border-crossing rate down some 70%.

;

;But a recent uptick in ;arrivals at the border;, combined with vastly higher numbers of people on their way north across Central and South America and riding dangerous cargo trains through Mexico, suggest the early deterrent effect is wearing off.

;

;Experts say the US lacks the capacity to detain and process migrants at the border, often making it impossible for the administration to carry out the harsh penalties it announced in May.

;

;As a result, some asylum seekers who cross illegally are being released into the US with a future court date, rather than being deported - becoming success stories repeated back to migrants still en route.

;

;"The (Biden administration) hit on a smart strategy, but they don't have the resources or capacity to implement it," said Andrew Selee, head of the Migration Policy Institute.

;

;Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador on Thursday derided the lack of an international plan to help countries lift their citizens out of poverty and thus avoid a key migration driver. He praised Biden for creating legal pathways for migrants but said they needed to be expanded.

;

;In Tijuana on Wednesday evening, opposite San Diego, several dozen people prepared to spend the night sleeping on the ground at a border entry point ahead of appointments early the next day, secured through a mobile app called CBP One, to enter the US and request asylum.

;

;But not everyone wants to wait.

;

;"My wife's family, and other people who came to Mexico with us, say they crossed (without an appointment) and nothing happened," said Venezuelan migrant Oscar Suarez, 27, sitting in a Tijuana plaza near the border with his pregnant wife, 2-year-old son and two brothers.

;

;He said he preferred to try the same strategy rather than wait on CBP One to obtain an appointment. Demand for appointments far outweighs the 1,450 time slots available borderwide per day, and Suarez said he worried that his family would not survive a long wait.

;

;"Our money ran out, and we don't have anything to eat," he said. "All the shelters in Tijuana are full. We have to do something."

;

;Enrique Lucero, Tijuana's director of migrant affairs, said migration slowed after the US policy change in May, but over the last several weeks has been picking up. Officials have tallied 65 nationalities of people in the city, he said.

;

;Hundreds of migrants who crossed without appointments have been forced to ;wait between two border walls;.

;

;Within the last eight days, US Customs and Border Protection (CBP) had processed more than 5,000 migrants in the San Diego area, a San Diego official said on Thursday.

;

;In Ciudad Juarez, opposite El Paso, hundreds of migrants squeezed past barbed wire to cross the Rio Grande river into the US, forming a line next to the border while awaiting processing by US officials.

;

;CBP has logged more than 1,000 migrant encounters daily in the El Paso area in the last several days, shows data published by the city of El Paso.

;

;Migrants are also crossing the river at the Texas city of Eagle Pass, where officials signed an emergency declaration on Tuesday to seek funding for additional services, and railroad operator Union Pacific said it was forced to ;shut service to Mexico;.

;

;Groups of migrants have been as large as 1,000 or 2,000 people, including several hundred migrants who braved a hailstorm to wade through the river.

;

;Mexican railroad operator Ferromex this week ;suspended service; on 60 trains to discourage migrants, who perilously ;ride north on cargo wagons;.

;

;A record of about 82,000 people last month entered Panama overland from South America, according to the International Organization for Migration (IOM), crossing the dangerous Darien Gap jungle that has transformed in recent years from a nearly impassable barrier to a ;migration thoroughfare;.

;

;As many as half a million people could end up crossing by year-end, double the number of 2022, said Giuseppe Loprete, head of IOM in Panama.

;

;Most people crossing the Darien left their home countries due to lack of employment, according to a July UN survey.

;

;An unprecedented number of migrants entering Mexico hail from ;other;;continents;, as the trek to the US southern border increasingly becomes a global migration route.

;

;The number of African migrants registered by Mexican authorities so far this year is already three times as high as during all 2022.

;

;"It's a structural, deeper problem. There's an exacerbated crisis globally, in many countries. People don't leave their countries because they want to - they do it out of need," President Lopez Obrador told reporters on Thursday.

;

;A US judge on Thursday restricted Sam Bankman-Fried's ability to call expert witnesses to testify at his criminal fraud trial, in a blow to the FTX cryptocurrency exchange founder.

;

;Bankman-Fried wanted to call seven experts on topics such as cryptocurrency markets and English contracts, to convince jurors to acquit him of stealing billions of dollars in FTX customer funds to plug losses at his Alameda Research hedge fund.

;

;But in a written order, US District Judge Lewis Kaplan said three proposed witnesses cannot take the stand, because their testimony was irrelevant or could confuse the jury.

;

;He also said Bankman-Fried may seek to call the remaining four experts, but only to rebut prosecution witnesses.

;

;Among the witnesses Kaplan rejected was Peter Vinella, a consultant who intended to testify about "FTX's use of widely-accepted practices in the financial services industry." Kaplan found the testimony irrelevant.

;

;Bankman-Fried also cannot call English barrister Lawrence Akka to testify about FTX's terms of service, which were governed by English law, because only a judge could tell jurors what the law is, Kaplan said.

;

;Court papers suggest Bankman-Fried may argue that the terms of service did not prevent the use of customer funds to make investments - much as banks use deposits to fund loans - and the practice had been common in the cryptocurrency industry.

;

;Bankman-Fried, a 31-year-old former billionaire, has pleaded not guilty. He has acknowledged inadequate risk management at FTX prior to its November 2022 collapse, but denied stealing funds.

;

;It is common in US criminal trials for prosecutors and defendants to call experts to help jurors understand complex issues.

;

;Prosecutors have said they plan to call three former FTX and Alameda executives, who have all pleaded guilty, to testify at Bankman-Fried's trial, which may last up to six weeks.
